column4: no, I have had these partitions for over year, I only repartitioned sda on install
and histo, "sudo fdisk -l" lists sdb, sdb1, sdb5, sdb6 and sdb7, so I should have those... also if I boot ubuntu 7.10 live cd, I can mount those drives
when you run "ls /dev/sd*" do you see the 5?
regardless of what fdisk is telling you, if you don't see the device you're NOT going to be able to mount it.  Good luck man.
ok thanks, thats what I thought
